939661990323d3dd795b5226b8a4d393 (20:02): what's the difference between class and id ?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:02): Bigun: Not the second!
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:03): babo:   ID is used once... class is used many times
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:03): DRMacIver:   It would be for IE browsers only
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:03): babo: ID names the element. class describes the element.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:03): names the element uniquely.
939661990323d3dd795b5226b8a4d393 (20:03): so ... #right-col  ... id='right-col' works, but class='right-col' doesn't ?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:04): babo: Well # is the ID selector.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:04): . is the class selector.
939661990323d3dd795b5226b8a4d393 (20:04): so with id I can only have one element called 'right-col', but with class I can have many 'right-col' ?

9e391be136de5b8a4f268e44dab318ac (20:04): Im having some issues with layout between firefox and internet explorer.. can someone take a look at http://paste.css-standards.org/1518 and tell me whats wrong with it
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:05): babo: Also an element can have multiple classes but only one ID.
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:06): DRMacIver:   Do they deserve any better?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:07): Bigun: Yes. They deserve a plain text minimal formatting page. :)
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:07): Two wrongs don't make a right.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:08): And table based layouts are as much in need of killing as IE is.
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:08): Maybe their next version will support CSS worth a crap..
939661990323d3dd795b5226b8a4d393 (20:08): DRMacIver: thanks ... but the problem I'm having is that my elements left_box_1, won't respond at all to class. But the first one will respond to id ... ?
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:08): I'm running Linux.. I wonder if wine will start IE
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:08): `css specificity
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (20:08): css specificity: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/cascade.html#specificity
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:09): babo: Read the above link. It might help enlighten you.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:09): In short it sounds like something is overriding the class you're trying to use.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:09): Bigun: I think it does, but it's a bit of a nuisance.
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:10): DRMacIver:   Anyway.... how do I get this logo centered... I'll worry about IE compatability when I feel like caring
939661990323d3dd795b5226b8a4d393 (20:10): DRMacIver, ok cool thanks ...
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:10): Bigun: Ok. margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: somethingorother;
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:11): Bigun: Alternatively position: absolute; left: 50%; margin-left: (-width/2);
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:11): DRMacIver:   Those are already set
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:11): Bigun: Should work then...
c5726fc748e56b1421ac7a83a2a3f7b0 (20:11): I thought computational arguements weren't allowed?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:12): Bigun: They're not.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:12): Bigun: That wasn't the literal code you should use.
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (20:12): You set a fixed width and then manually plug in -width/2
